metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2572 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
http.cc in Squid 4.x before 4.0.7 relies on the HTTP status code after a response-parsing failure, which allows remote HTTP servers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon exit) via a malformed response.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.4
squid-cgi - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.4
squid-purge - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.4
squid3 - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.4
squid3-common - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.4
squidclient - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This CVE is only for the 'Do not use parsing leftovers, such as HTTP response status code' part of the squid-4-14548.patch patch. As such, it is 4.x only.

criterions.comment: squid3 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-1ubuntu6.4').
